meanings.definition: A postmortem examination to discover the cause of death or the extent of disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor conducted an autopsy to find out why the person passed away.
meanings.sent2: The autopsy revealed that the illness had affected multiple organs.
meanings.sent3: During the autopsy, the doctor discovered a surprising clue about the person's health.
meanings.sent4: The autopsy was like a detective investigation into the person's final moments.
meanings.sent5: The autopsy provided crucial insights into the mysterious death.

meanings.definition: To perform an autopsy on a deceased body.
meanings.sent1: The medical examiner will autopsy the body to determine the cause of death.
meanings.sent2: It is important to autopsy the deceased to understand what happened.
meanings.sent3: The detective jokingly asked if they needed to autopsy the expired pizza.
meanings.sent4: She decided to autopsy the problem to get to the root of it.
meanings.sent5: He will autopsy the data to uncover any hidden patterns.
